intro: Dysoxylum brachypodum, commonly known as the short-stemmed dysoxylum, is a tropical tree belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in panicles, followed by woody capsules that contain several seeds. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
